thread.title_full: Duke Golf Kicks Off Eighth Birdies for Babies Fundraising Season - BVM Sports

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Duke Golf Kicks Off Eighth Birdies for Babies Fundraising Season - BVM Sports
text: Duke's men's and wo men's golf team s are gearing up for the 2024-25 season and marking the eighth year of the Birdies for Babies program, which supports the Duke Children's Neonatal and Pediatric Intensive Care Units. Launched by former champion Virginia Elena Carta, the initiative has raised $124,333.80 over its seven-year history, leading to the dedication of a hospital room in honor of its contributions. Dr. Ann M. Reed commends the program's legacy and its impact on inspiring other student-athletes. Fans can support the program through pledges or donations based on birdies made during the season. The golf teams begin their seasons on September 7-11 with events in Washington and Minnesota. - $124,333.80 raised for Duke Children's since 2016. - A dedicated hospital room established after surpassing $100,000 in donations. - The Birdies for Babies program is well-established and supports critically ill children. - The men's golf team starts its season on Sept. 7-8; the women's team on Sept. 9-11. The golf teams will aim for notable performance to maximize pledges for the Birdies for Babies initiative, potentially increasing community support. As new seasons unfold, further outreach and partnerships with similar initiatives may develop.Bottom Line The Birdies for Babies program stands as a vital community initiative, showcasing the commitment of Duke student-athletes to support vulnerable children, while emphasizing the potential for growth and greater impact in the upcoming season.
